meanings.sent1: She was mogging to catch the bus before it left.
meanings.sent2: The cat was mogging after the laser pointer.
meanings.sent3: The squirrel was mogging around the tree, trying to find its hidden acorn stash.
meanings.sent4: Time was mogging along, not waiting for anyone to catch up.
meanings.sent5: The river was mogging downstream, carrying leaves with it.

meanings.definition: The act of moving quickly or hurriedly.
meanings.sent1: His mogging through the crowd caught everyone's attention.
meanings.sent2: The mogging of the cheetah amazed the spectators at the zoo.
meanings.sent3: The mogging of the penguin on the ice was quite comical.
meanings.sent4: The mogging of the wind through the trees sounded like a distant train.
meanings.sent5: The mogging of the ants in a line was fascinating to watch.

meanings.definition: A person who moves quickly or hurriedly.
meanings.sent1: The mogging passed by in a blur, leaving us wondering who it was.
meanings.sent2: The little mogging in the race surprised everyone with their speed.
meanings.sent3: The mogging in the park was like a whirlwind, always in a rush.
meanings.sent4: She was a mogging in the office, getting things done in record time.
meanings.sent5: The mogging at the marathon set a new personal best.
